title: Print, "Elevation and Plan for a Public Fountain", 1745
medium: Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper
inscribed:
On plate, upper center: 12me. Livre; upper center, in the image: Livre de Fontaines, proper a placer dans le milieu d'unne place publique, Inventées  par François de/Cuvilliés, premier Architecte de leurs A.S.E. de Baviere, ét de Cologne.; upper right: M.; lower center: Se vend a Paris Chez le Sr. Poilly ruë St./Iacque a limage St. Benoit Avec Privilege du Roy. ét aussi chez l'auteur.; lower right: 1.

Note: The 2nd impression in a second state with a new number, upper left: 7, and the number lower right, partly removed.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux (D. 80 and 81)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Elevation and Plan for a Public Fountain", 1745.
1745. Etching and engraving on off-white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-285-63.
